content: this text is a legal document explaining the progress of a case involving the liquidation and distribution of an estate the parties involved are mrs d and mrs j the document discusses various claims made by mrs d including late notification claims and reimbursement of costs it also addresses the housing allowance and reimbursement of property tax some claims are dismissed while others are settled the document outlines the composition of the estate including assets and liabilities and calculates the rights of mrs d and mrs j considering inheritance tax and other factors the notary reminds the parties about a letter from the bailiff which allows them to review the statement of liquidation and raise objections within one month if there are no objections the statement becomes final but if there are disputes it may need to be approved by a court once approved a division is concluded and recorded in an official report the parties then issue a statement and file it with the court for approval once approved the joint ownership between the parties ceases to exist the text concludes by stating that the statement has been drawn and concluded and it is signed by the notary in antwerp
